[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Revenue and Financial System (RFS) defines requirements for budgeting, authentication, and BDW integration while ensuring security and compliance.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: RFS supports financial planning, user authentication, data integration, and system performance optimization.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: RFS integrates with BDW for data loading, UAS for authentication, and ENET intranet.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: RFS provides a structured web UI with role-based access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: RFS runs on workstations requiring 400MB disk space.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: RFS uses REST APIs, PostgreSQL for financial data, and a secondary database.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: RFS ensures secure data exchange with BDW and UAS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: RFS optimizes transactions for budgeting workflows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: RFS operates 24/7 with 98% uptime during budgeting cycles.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: RFS links to authentication, reporting, and BDW data services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: RFS facilitates budgeting, access control, BDW integration, and compliance monitoring.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: RFS  is designed for finance teams, budget analysts, and administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: RFS requires authenticated users, BDW data availability, and ENET compliance.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: RFS relies on BDW updates, UAS authentication, and ENET integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Budgeting Period: Annual financial planning cycle.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall authenticate users via UAS role-based access.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support up to five BDW test file loads annually.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall comply with ENET intranet standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enforce role-based access and allow authorized users to manage budgets (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall apply revenue and expense formula updates before budgeting and reflect BDW changes (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall enable 98% of users to complete budgets successfully after training.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process transactions within 2 seconds for 90% of requests and within 10 seconds for the remaining 10%.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall maintain 90% annual uptime, 98% during budgeting, with a 1-hour restoration time.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store user roles, financial data, and budgeting history.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall meet ENET intranet standards, achieving 95% approval pre-release.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall restrict access based on UAS authentication.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall apply annual budgeting formula updates before implementation.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Budgeting workflows, system availability, and authentication shall be validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: System documentation, UI guidelines, and compliance policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Budgeting security and data integration standards.
